parts.title: The World’s Gone Nuts Overview
parts.body: In "The World’s Gone Nuts", Piers Morgan highlights the bizarre happenings that made him realize our world is losing its groundedness. From Rachel Dolezal's racial identity claims to schools avoiding the word “girls" and James Bond turning female, these absurdities signal a societal drift away from common sense. The modern obsession with "wokeness" reveals an intolerant liberalism that stifles free speech and conversation. Morgan, a self-proclaimed liberal, is critical of this shift and longs for genuine freedom and tolerance, values he believes have been lost in the illiberal liberalism age.

parts.title: Evolution of Perspectives
parts.body: Summary: Evolution of Perspectives In the wake of the coronavirus, the author realized the profound impact this global crisis had on his and others' views on life. Initially, the pandemic united people by drawing focus towards family, community, and essential workers while sidelining 'woke' culture. However, the societal shift did not last; after events like George Floyd's killing, a 'summer of madness' ensued, marked by an explosion in illiberal liberalism which the author saw as destructive. This led him to shelve his initial book idea on woke culture, as the pandemic's drastic changes prompted him to reconsider his thoughts and actions. Impact of the Pandemic on Individuals The narrative takes readers through the author's experience as his status shifted from being a maligned figure to being lauded by those who once criticized him. He now records his observations in a diary format to capture real-time changes, illustrating how coronavirus provided a 'wake-up moment' globally that must persevere. Despite some societal polarization, the crisis forced reflection and adaptation across communities, revealing the necessity for more inclusive perspectives.

parts.title: Controversy Around Race and Royal Decisions
parts.body: Laurence Fox faces backlash after a heated debate about Meghan Markle's media coverage, labeled as racist by some, which Fox dismisses. This exchange, spotlighting the divisive nature of racial discourse in Britain, triggers cancellations and questions about freedom of speech. The uproar illustrates the tension between acknowledging racism and the 'cancel culture' that often seeks to silence dissenting voices. In the broader context, former US President Barack Obama criticizes cancel culture, advocating for more constructive activism. Highlighted here is the risk that judgmental attitudes and hypersensitivity can hinder genuine progress and dialogue, resonating with ongoing debates about racism and public criticism. Meanwhile, the Queen makes firm decisions regarding Harry and Meghan, ordering them to repay funds and withdraw from royal duties, marking a significant turning point for the royal family amidst public scrutiny.

parts.title: Society's Divides & Oscars Controversy
parts.body: Society's Divisions and Woke Culture In recent events, societal divides seem to be widening over issues like Brexit, which has led to polarized opinions, similar to Trump's presidency and the controversies surrounding Meghan and Harry. Many people find themselves caught in the middle, advocating for democracy and fairness despite the lack of nuance in political debates. Meanwhile, celebrities like Nicky Hilton and Elizabeth Warren engage in virtue signaling, further disconnecting them from the average person. Good Morning Britain has become a platform to challenge "woke" culture, but I am beginning to question if I sometimes cross the line from being provocative to bullying. Oscars and Diversity Discussion The Oscars night turned into a display of self-righteousness, focusing on diversity issues highlighted by actors like Joaquin Phoenix, who condemned systemic racism, yet the problem of lack of diversity persists. Despite the Parasite's win offering a nod to diversity, the ceremony often seemed a desperate attempt to appease critics regarding inclusion. Furthermore, PETA's campaign to change common phrases deemed offensive showcases how activism sometimes takes counterproductive turns, prompting solid resistance instead of promoting change.

parts.title: Government's Coronavirus Response & Media Accountability
parts.body: The government banned ministers from appearing on GMB to avoid accountability during the coronavirus crisis. Matt Hancock eventually appeared only after the show offered airtime to his rival, Jon Ashworth. The crisis shows the importance of having government officials address the public on important issues in order to inform and calm them. In the US, former candidates drop out leaving old white males as the only Democratic presidential candidates, highlighting potential hypocrisy in the Democratic party regarding their diversity values. With the coronavirus spreading fast and declared a high-level emergency by NHS England, Hancock's assurance of following scientific advice seems inadequate, given the virus's swift transmission and the government’s reluctance to enforce measures such as lockdowns or cancelling mass gatherings.

parts.title: Pandemic Escalation & Feminist Discourse
parts.body: With fears of a major coronavirus outbreak, Boris Johnson appeared relaxed at first, even shaking hands in a hospital with infected patients. Yet WHO’s Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus warned that the death rate was rising and we were in "unchartered territory." Significant measures were being taken worldwide such as lockdown in Lombardy, yet the UK initially seemed complacent in comparison. The public criticism towards events like the Cheltenham Festival proceeding was vocal. Medical professionals were urging an urgent lockdown to minimize the pandemic’s impact. As for feminist discussions during the pandemic, while some believed lockdown reinforced gender roles, there was criticism for certain celebrities showing inconsistencies in their feminist principles. For example, Kim Kardashian and Emily Ratajkowski's nude selfies were criticized as not representing true feminist values. Instead, genuine leadership was shown by women like Robin Wright fighting for equal pay.

parts.title: Woke Criticism & Celebrity Virtue-Signaling
parts.body: Legend faced criticism for tackling 'Baby, It's Cold Outside'. Many, including Dean Martin's daughter, Deana, see it as a fun holiday song. Yet, others argue he's silent on misogynistic lyrics in modern music. Some call it a woke campaign issue, ignoring that the song in 'Neptune's Daughter' features both a male and female persisting to keep their partner from leaving, a point often overlooked. Critics argue campaigns against the song don't address real gender issues, calling for a focus on offensive contemporary lyrics. As the coronavirus spread, some hoped celebrities would stop virtue-signaling, instead showing solidarity with health workers on the frontline. However, instances like Gal Gadot's 'Imagine' video, featuring stars singing tunelessly, sparked criticism. The pandemic exposes the ritual self-promotion and hypocrisy of some celebrities, seen as out of touch from reality, singing about worlds without possessions from their luxurious homes. This tone-deaf move reminds viewers of wealth disparities, not aligning with Lennon's intended message.

parts.title: Government Failures & Heroic Acts Amidst Crisis
parts.body: In the midst of the coronavirus pandemic, the UK government is facing backlash for its inadequate response, particularly in testing and providing PPE for NHS workers. As the death toll rises, Piers is incensed by irresponsible decisions by public figures, such as football clubs seeking taxpayer money despite profits, or celebrities promoting themselves rather than offering real help. The narrative highlights a contrast between those exploiting the crisis and individuals like Captain Tom Moore, who embodies selflessness, raising millions for the NHS through a simple gesture of walking laps in his garden. Meanwhile, as Americans protest lockdown measures, spurred by Trump's rhetoric against expert advice, Piers reflects on the importance of truth and sensible action over politically fueled rebellion. He is critical of President Trump’s handling of the crisis, noting the dangerous impacts of rhetoric that undermines public health measures. Piers continues to champion the contribution of immigrants and NHS workers, advocating for recognition and a reevaluation of their roles and treatment post-crisis.

parts.title: Trump's Reckless COVID-19 Advice and Pandemic Media Reactions
parts.body: President Trump suggested the absurd idea of injecting bleach as a COVID-19 cure, sparking reckless public reactions. Despite scientific insights from William Bryan at the Department of Homeland Security, Trump's handling of COVID-19 briefings showed a disregard for expert opinions, causing global concern. The media briefings have turned into self-promotional rallies rather than informative sessions, leading to disastrous consequences. Former President Trump's controversial advice on hydroxychloroquine similarly endangered lives and showed his tendency to undermine scientific guidance for personal agendas. Later, in May, a discussion emerged about the reaction to the lockdowns and Trump unfollowing Piers Morgan was noted. Meanwhile, OFCOM supported Piers Morgan's robust interview style amidst the pandemic, encouraging freedom of speech against government criticism. A further insight on British ministers' performances during the crisis highlighted a divide in public opinion, some viewing Morgan as a voice of reason during governmental scrutiny. There was also a segment on the societal divide, addressing the impact of COVID-19 in varying communities and the unrealistic portrayal of body images in the media.

parts.title: Failures & Cummings Scandal
parts.body: The failure of the UK's coronavirus response is highlighted with a poll showing public disapproval for the government. In Belgium, healthcare workers protested against their government's poor handling. In the UK, Matt Hancock falsely claimed a protective ring was created around care homes from the start, which was debunked on GMB as a lie by family members affected. Government mistakes worsen as they continue to cover their failures with lies. Amidst political upheaval, Captain Tom Moore was knighted, much to his delight. Tensions rise as Dominic Cummings, an aide to Boris Johnson, was exposed for breaking lockdown rules, triggering public and political backlash. This scandal questions the authority of lockdown laws and causes public defiance. Journalists and the public react as Boris Johnson supports Cummings, leading to further enragement.

parts.title: Increased Division Amid BLM Protests and "Cancel Culture" Backlash
parts.body: Today, Black Lives Matter protests are being overshadowed by actions that provoke societal division. Recent clashes, such as between police and protestors, and instances of violent rhetoric, highlight the destructive behavior that distracts from the core issues of racial injustice and inequality. People like Hannah Jane Parkinson are criticized for hypocrisy; they preach mental health awareness but embody cruelty online. In other news, J.K. Rowling faces backlash for her views on transgender issues, illustrating the culture of "cancel" prevalent today. Rowling's controversial opinions hit headlines as she defends the concept of "sex is real," prompting organizations like GLAAD to accuse her of supporting an ideology that misrepresents gender identity. The recent focus on "cancel culture" highlights a growing intolerance for diverse viewpoints, prioritizing uniform agreement over dialogue.

parts.title: The Dilemma of Self-Identification
parts.body: Rachel Dolezal is caught in a web of lies claiming she is black, despite being born to white parents. Her history includes deception about her identity while leading an NAACP chapter, and ironically suing a university for racial discrimination as a white person. When confronted, she maintains, it's complex, treating her racial claim as valid self-identification. Her actions highlight the controversial extremes of self-identification. Even when exposed, Dolezal continued to defend her stance using comparisons to gender identification, questioning why race should be treated differently. Her case points to the dangers of unchecked self-identification and how it can lead to manipulation for personal gain.
